keyMoments.title: Confronts Magellan
keyMoments.description: Luffy faces off against Chief Warden Magellan on Level 4, beginning one of his most dangerous battles.
keyMoments.significance: First direct confrontation with Magellan, establishing the severity of the threat.
keyMoments.quote: If I can't win without hitting you... then I'll just have to hit you!

keyMoments.title: Activates Gear Second Against Magellan
keyMoments.description: Luffy activates Gear Second to fight Magellan, recognizing the need for his enhanced abilities.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy taking the threat seriously by using one of his most powerful techniques.

keyMoments.title: Lands Jet Bazooka on Magellan
keyMoments.description: Luffy successfully hits Magellan with a Gomu Gomu no Jet Bazooka, injuring the Chief Warden.
keyMoments.significance: First successful attack on Magellan, but at great cost to Luffy.

keyMoments.title: Gets Poisoned by Magellan
keyMoments.description: Luffy's hands become coated with deadly poison after hitting Magellan, beginning a life-threatening crisis.
keyMoments.significance: The attack's cost becomes clear - Luffy is now infected with lethal poison that will nearly kill him.
keyMoments.quote: The poison... it's eating away at my hands!

reveals.information: Willing to sacrifice his own life to save Ace, even accepting deadly poisoning

keyMoments.title: Confronts Luffy on Level 4
keyMoments.description: Magellan appears before Luffy, blocking his path and forcing a direct confrontation.
keyMoments.significance: First major battle between Magellan and Luffy, showcasing the Chief Warden's overwhelming power.

keyMoments.title: Uses Hydra Attack
keyMoments.description: Magellan creates a multi-headed poison hydra to attack Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: First display of Magellan's signature technique in combat against Luffy.

keyMoments.title: Uses Chloro Ball
keyMoments.description: Magellan launches a poisonous gas projectile at Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the range and versatility of Magellan's poison attacks.

keyMoments.title: Uses Venom Road
keyMoments.description: Magellan travels through his own poison to pursue Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Magellan's tactical use of poison for mobility.

keyMoments.title: Takes Direct Hit from Luffy
keyMoments.description: Magellan is hit by Luffy's Jet Bazooka, the first time he's been successfully damaged in the arc.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that even Magellan can be hurt, but at great cost to the attacker.

abilities.description: Creates a multi-headed poison hydra that pursues and envelops opponents in lethal poison.
Launches a poisonous gas projectile at range.
Travels through poison at high speed for tactical movement.

reveals.information: Demonstrates three new poison techniques: Hydra, Chloro Ball, and Venom Road
Can be damaged by direct physical attacks, despite his poison body

keyMoments.title: Warns Luffy About Magellan's Poison
keyMoments.description: Bentham desperately warns Luffy about the danger of Magellan's poison body.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Bentham's knowledge of Magellan's abilities and his concern for Luffy's safety.
keyMoments.quote: His entire body is poison! You can't touch him!

keyMoments.title: Flees from Magellan Battle
keyMoments.description: Bentham tearfully abandons Luffy, unable to help against Magellan without dying.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the emotional weight of choosing self-preservation over loyalty to a friend.
keyMoments.quote: I'm sorry, Straw-chan! I can't... I can't help you!

relationships.description: Bentham shows deep concern for Luffy's safety but is forced to flee, creating emotional conflict.

evolutionMoments.description: Bentham tearfully flees from Magellan, unable to help Luffy without dying.

reveals.information: Despite his friendship with Luffy, Bentham chooses self-preservation when faced with certain death

keyMoments.title: Attempts Escape with Mr. 3
keyMoments.description: Buggy and Mr. 3 try to reach Level 3 while Magellan is distracted.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Buggy's opportunistic nature, trying to use the chaos to escape.

keyMoments.title: Attacks Hannyabal
keyMoments.description: Buggy uses Muggy Ball against Hannyabal, not trusting his offer of safe passage.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Buggy's distrust of prison guards and his willingness to fight.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Hannyabal
keyMoments.description: Despite his confidence, Buggy is easily defeated by Vice Warden Hannyabal.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that Buggy severely underestimated Hannyabal's strength.

keyMoments.title: Attempts Escape with Buggy
keyMoments.description: Mr. 3 and Buggy try to reach Level 3 during the chaos of Luffy's battle.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Mr. 3's survival instinct and opportunism.
keyMoments.quote: It is all over if Magellan comes.

keyMoments.title: Attacks Hannyabal
keyMoments.description: Mr. 3 uses his Doru Doru abilities against Hannyabal.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates his distrust of Hannyabal's offer.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Hannyabal
keyMoments.description: Mr. 3 is easily defeated by Hannyabal alongside Buggy.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the gap in power between the prisoners and Impel Down's staff.

keyMoments.title: Offers Safe Passage to Buggy and Mr. 3
keyMoments.description: Hannyabal offers to let Buggy and Mr. 3 pass, planning to use their escape to get Magellan fired.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals Hannyabal's ambition to become Chief Warden and his willingness to compromise duty.
keyMoments.quote: I'll let you pass... so I can get Magellan fired!

keyMoments.title: Defeats Buggy and Mr. 3
keyMoments.description: Hannyabal easily defeats both Buggy and Mr. 3, proving far stronger than expected.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Hannyabal as a formidable combatant, not just a comedic character.

reveals.information: Ambitious to become Chief Warden, willing to let prisoners escape to get Magellan in trouble
Much stronger than he appears, easily defeating both Buggy and Mr. 3
